result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Benjamin Luis Pampuch

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Benjamin Luis Pampuch in court.  Attorney Jaymes K. Fenton in court for Benjamin Luis Pampuch.  Attorney Amy E Spanczak in court for State of Wisconsin. Parties have reached a resolution. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.  

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNT 1.  
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNT 2.  

Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen deportation is possible. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived their rights.  Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Defendant is advised is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms.  
Defendant is advised unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored.  

Matter adjourned for sentencing hearing in Branch 16.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Received and Filed.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Violation Report 9-28-2022
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Violation Report 7-20-2022

Defendant Benjamin Luis Pampuch in court with attorney Jaymes K. Fenton.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Benjamin Luis Pampuch appeared by video means. Court addresses justice point reports. Parties are continuing negotiations, Defense is requesting a plea and sentencing date. Case is adjourned in Branch 16.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Justice Point Violation Report forwarded to Judge for review and filed.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Status Report 6-27-2022

Defendant Benjamin Luis Pampuch in court with attorney Jaymes K. Fenton.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Fenton appeared by video means. Case is adjourned in Branch 16.  Status conference scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 6-13-2022, Filed

Defendant Benjamin Luis Pampuch in court with attorney Jaymes K. Fenton.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO. Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 16, Judge Grayson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 5-13-2022

Defendant Benjamin Luis Pampuch in court with attorney Jaymes K. Fenton. Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Order to Show Cause Hearing. Defendant no longer needs public defender, as the court has since appointed Attorney Fenton. Discussions put forth on the record. Defense counsel requests Preliminary Hearing date. Case adjourned to Prelim Court.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 5-3-2022
Received and Filed. SPD Order Appointing Counsel

Defendant Benjamin Luis Pampuch in court via zoom without counsel.  Amy E spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The case in court for indigency hearing.  The indigency hearing was via zoom.  The court held a colloquy with the defendant and according to the court records the defendant is eligible for Public Defender's Appointment.  The Court will set the matter for Order to show cause via zoom in Branch 16.  Order to show cause hearing scheduled for May 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Benjamin Luis Pampuch not in court.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant appears without counsel.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Court orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing.  Indigency hearing scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Benjamin Luis Pampuch in court.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 3-18-2022

09:40 AM Defendant Benjamin Luis Pampuch in court.  amy E spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.Defendant Benjamin Luis Pampuch in court.  amy E spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Matter scheduled for Indigency Hearing.  Defendant advised Court that he spoke with public defender's office and he nows qualifies for representation.  Case remains scheduled for Preliminary Hearing on 3/21/2022 at 8:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report Received and Filed.
Preliminary hearing on March 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Indigency hearing on March 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Benjamin Luis Pampuch in court in person.  Matthew Zisi appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Defendant appears without counsel; is not eligible for SPD appointment and has not retained.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson Branch 16. Court orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing.  Indigency hearing scheduled for March 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

02/13/2022

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3. Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.  No driving during pendency of case.

Defendant Benjamin Luis Pampuch in court with attorney Kathryn A Holtz.  Defendant Benjamin Luis Pampuch in custody.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Benjamin Luis Pampuch appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
